title: Reactions: The peloton congratulates Cavendish
content:
Reactions: The peloton congratulates Cavendish

Five years after his last Tour de France stage win, Mark Cavendish (Deceunick-QuickStep) sprinted to victory on Tuesday in a town that he had already seen before from atop the winner’s podium. The victory was one that seemed far, far away just eight months ago, after he left the Gent-Wevelgem media zone in tears having admitted that it may have been his last race as a professional.

Social media collectively lost its mind when Cavendish crossed the finish line first in Fougères and, about an hour later, the peloton’s tweets poured in with their own congratulations. Below is collection of those messages and we dare you not to cry while reading them. Enjoy!

Remember: Lion never sleeps! 🦁
LEGEND! 👏🏻 @MarkCavendish#TDF2021
📷 @GettySport pic.twitter.com/ulfuEy6Mky

— Michał Kwiatkowski (@kwiato) June 29, 2021

So awesome seeing @MarkCavendish prove the doubters wrong today 🤫😁 #TDF2021

— Chris Froome (@chrisfroome) June 29, 2021

This. pic.twitter.com/l5FPdMXElJ

— Peta Cavendish (@petatodd) June 29, 2021

😭😮 https://t.co/yPv7IVgDNR

— Fred Wright (@fred_wright0) June 29, 2021

Hoy a ganado el ciclismo!@MarkCavendish smash it!! Congrats mate🥳 #chapeau #TDF2021 pic.twitter.com/98xT00Jqtc

— Iván Garcia Cortina (@ivan_cortina) June 29, 2021

I've seen Cav at his very best & I've seen him work so hard through his toughest moments. And even I didn't expect that today. This sport knocks you down time & again but if you keep getting back up it can reward you in incredible ways. Cav always gets back up. Proud of you mate pic.twitter.com/tpQAVzXTvu

— Geraint Thomas (@GeraintThomas86) June 29, 2021

When sporting greats fade, you question whether the standards have increased, whether that athlete would have won in the modern era, even at their peak.

Mark Cavendish has now beaten three generations of the best sprinters, on the biggest stage. No more questions needed.

— Daniel Lloyd (@daniellloyd1) June 29, 2021

Cav winning brings on so much nostalgia and I’m here for it. To be honest, after the last three days, I feel like the entire cycling community is here for it. Simpler times!

— Chloe Hosking (@chloe_hosking) June 29, 2021

Disappointed I could not deliver a 3rd victory in a row for the team. It’s always nice to fight out some fair sprints with a true legend @MarkCavendish. We go again! 💪 #TDF2021 pic.twitter.com/ERaLmIINVi

— Jasper Philipsen (@JasperPhilipsen) June 29, 2021

There are no words to describe today so I will leave it to this : Just wow, what a man and what a team 👊🏻 Congrats @markcavendish #WayToRide #TheWolfpack
@deceuninck_quickstep
📸 @gettyimages pic.twitter.com/H8cCsMlGG8

— Kasper Asgreen (@k_asgreen) June 29, 2021

Cav back in January camp and still tiny room for improvement.. But it ain’t over before the Fat Boy sings ✌🏻@deceuninck_qst pic.twitter.com/423LO6336N

— Brian Holm (@brianholm1962) June 29, 2021
